title: more like a "I know!" question
content:
For my portfolio for college applications, I want to re-design a famous furniture/ modern home company. whether its a catalogs or buses, I want to design them all!  
So heres my question to all of you.  
Please list every possible old-school companies that still exist that you know about.  
EX: Knoll, Vignelli associates, Helvetica loving companies.
author: Ken W

comments.content:
"There's More to Modern" by Rob Forbes :  
 [http://trex.id.iit.edu/events/strategyconference/2006/perspectives\_forbe...](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730065807/http:/trex.id.iit.edu/events/strategyconference/2006/perspectives_forbes.php "http://trex.id.iit.edu/events/strategyconference/2006/perspectives\_forbes.php")

Oh, I just noticed the age of the thread. :o

I was thinking Swedese: [http://www.swedese.se/home/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730065807/http:/www.swedese.se/home/ "http://www.swedese.se/home/")

Oh my! This is quite the resurrection.
\*blink\* \*blink\* This would have got the mods on Fukufics hopping.

@Té: Howso?

@Ken: Start by investigating the work of old designers like Müller-Brockmann and conduct your research from there.

It happened there, too, at the same time. The poor slob got told off by a mod for thread necromancy. Wonder why. :straight-faced:

Aside: Thread necromancy is the act of reviving old threads. It's very easy to forget or never notice that a thread is past its sell-by date when one gets deep into the reading, especially with weak or no telltales. I still don't know what's the best telltale, probably a reasonably well-sized "Last post: ### ago." just above the submit button.
